10 years ago, when I bought my home in the USA, I had to go through a ton of manual paperwork for the mortgage process.

I still remember manually signing more than 50 documents 🤢

Fast forward to 2025—many of these mortgage-related workflows are now being automated using AI.

Benchmark Mortgage is one such company that leveraged OpenAI + Zapier to transform a slow, manual compliance process into a seamless, AI-powered automation.

If you're curious to learn more about this real-life AI case study, join a free online webinar on April 24th, where you'll discover:

⟹️ How to connect form submissions to tools like Jotform, monday dot com, Dropbox, and PerformLine to create a scalable, streamlined compliance pipeline

⟹️ Practical tips for keeping your data clean and well-structured across systems

⟹️ How Benchmark automated their content review process while staying compliant with strict regulations—a workflow so effective, it blew away their legal team

👉 Registration link in the comments ⬇🏼

Feel free to repost this within your network—perfect for anyone interested in real-world AI automation!

Demystifying Data Shuffling in Apache Spark
Behind the scenes of wide transformations

Ever wondered why some of your Spark jobs take longer than expected?
The root cause often lies in Data Shuffling – one of the most resource-intensive operations in Apache Spark.

What is Data Shuffling?
In simple terms, shuffling is the process of redistributing data across nodes in a cluster.
It’s triggered during wide transformations like:

groupByKey
reduceByKey
join
cogroup

When Spark needs to group or aggregate data by key across partitions, it must shuffle the data to ensure all related records are processed together.

Key Insights from the Guide:

Shuffle is not a transformation—it’s an internal process triggered by transformations.

Even operations like repartition() or sortBy(), although not categorized as wide, can cause a shuffle.

Shuffle = Stage Break: Every shuffle operation results in a new stage in Spark.

It involves disk I/O, network transfer, serialization, and GC overhead—making it an expensive operation.


Common Causes of Shuffling:

Data skew
Poor partitioning
Join and aggregation operations
Cache overflows
Lack of data locality


Best Practices to Reduce Shuffle Overhead:
Use reduceByKey instead of groupByKey
Cache intermediate results when reused
Apply coalesce() to reduce partitions post shuffle
Minimize unnecessary wide transformations
Monitor shuffle metrics in Spark UI


Default config: spark.sql.shuffle.partitions = 200
Tip: Adjust this based on job size for better performance!

Credit to the Arvind Kumar for putting together such a concise and impactful guide on this topic.

If you're a data engineer or working with Spark at scale, this is a must-read to understand and optimize your jobs effectively.

Like, comment, and repost to help others in your network. Follow Monojit Saha for more such insights.

Empowering Women in Cybersecurity 🚀

I recently had the privilege of attending the StoneX conference on 'Women in Cybersecurity' along with my friends and it was an incredible experience! 🌟 The conference highlighted the importance of women's roles in the cybersecurity domain and the various challenges and opportunities that come with it.

Key Takeaways:

- Cybersecurity Challenges: Gained insights into the key challenges faced in the cybersecurity domain, including data security, threat modeling, and more.
- Women in Leadership: Met inspiring women leaders in the industry, including Deepti Mayee Satapathy , Avanti Deodhar , Neha Puri, Lekshmi Nair and Anshu Sharma , who shared their experiences and expertise.
- Career Growth: Learned about the skills and competencies required to succeed in the cybersecurity field, including automation tools, CICD tools, and more.
- Agentic AI: Explored the applications of Agentic AI in cybersecurity and its potential to make a big difference in the field.

Speakers and Sessions:

- Deepti Mayee Satapathy (Manager) - Shared her experience and the importance of cybersecurity
- Avanti Deodhar (Lead Engineer) - Spoke about automation tools and CICD tools
- Neha Puri (Development Manager) - Discussed HR functions and winning people practices
- Anurag Mathur (Staff Engineer) - Taught about browser fingerprinting and key challenges.
- Lekshmi Nair (President of WiCys India) - Spoke about application security and cloud security and highlighted WiCys
- Anshu Sharma (Executive Director at Wells Fargo) - Shared insights on GenAi and Agentic AI along with real life scenarios.
-Sampath C (Talent Acquisition Business partner) - clearly shared the Strategy, skills, StoneX values..

Rapid Fire Round:

- Valuable insights from Chetan Anand (Associate Vice President and CISO) and Niranjini A. Arunachalam (Director, Technology and Transformation, Cyber at Deloitte)


- The conference motivated me to learn more about cybersecurity and its importance in today's world.
- It's essential to have more women in the cybersecurity field, and I'm excited to see the impact they can make.

Quick Profile Fixes You Can Do Today
✅ Headline That Sells
Use your current role + impact + value prop.
Example: 'Frontend Dev | Built scalable apps | 2M+ users served.'

✅ Banner That Speaks
Create a custom banner using Canva to show personality or expertise.

✅ About Section = Your Pitch
Start with:
✨ Who you are
✨ What problem you solve
✨ What you’re looking for

✅ SEO Your Skills
Add 50+ relevant keywords recruiters search for. Use Jobscan to check relevance.

✅ Custom URL
Ditch the ugly URL.
Go to settings → customize → look professional.

✅ Recommendations Work Like Google Reviews
Ask 3 ex-colleagues or managers to endorse you.
Give first, then ask.

✅ Add Media/Portfolio
Show off your wins.
Use Notion or Behance to embed samples.

✅ Profile Photo
Use PFP Maker to get a free pro-looking headshot in seconds.

---

Excited to Share My Third Project!
I recently completed the IBM HR Analytics Attrition Project using Google Colab, and it’s been an incredible learning experience working on a real-world business problem!
🔍 In this project, I analyzed employee data to identify the key factors that contribute to employee attrition and built predictive models to help HR teams take proactive action.
💡 Key Highlights:
Performed Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to uncover hidden patterns in HR data and applied feature engineering techniques to prepare the dataset for modeling
Built and evaluated Machine Learning models (Logistic Regression, Random Forest, etc.) to predict attrition
Gained valuable insights into HR analytics and how data can drive better people decisions
💻 Tools & Technologies Used:
Google Colab
Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
Data Cleaning | Visualization | Modeling | Interpretation
🤗 A huge thank you to Unified Mentor for their amazing mentorship and the opportunity to work on a real-world industry project. Your guidance helped me apply theoretical knowledge to a meaningful use case.

Elated to Chronicle a Defining Milestone in My Internship Journey! 🌟
I am delighted to share the successful culmination of my 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗲-𝗺𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗵 tenure as a 𝙁𝙞𝙣𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝘼𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙮𝙨𝙩 𝙄𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙣 at Unified Mentor Private Limited, spanning from 15th January 2025 to 15th April 2025.

This internship has been nothing short of transformative - a dynamic blend of intellectual rigor, practical immersion, and strategic mentorship. Over the course of this enriching engagement, I had the privilege of honing my financial acumen, strengthening my analytical prowess, and delving into industry-relevant tools such as Microsoft Excel and Power BI.

🧠 Core Competencies Acquired:
· In-depth financial analysis and interpretation
· Advanced Excel-based financial modelling
· Data visualization and dashboarding via Power BI
· Exposure to real-time market dynamics and actionable insights

The unwavering support and insightful guidance from the team at Unified Mentor have played a pivotal role in shaping my foundational understanding of the financial landscape. Their structured learning ecosystem and commitment to intern development have left an indelible impact on my professional outlook.

I am immensely grateful for this opportunity and look forward with great enthusiasm to leveraging these learnings as I continue to evolve both professionally and personally. 🚀

If you interview at Microsoft, you’ll go through at least two tough DSA rounds, then system design or project-based interviews, and only then culture fit.

If you interview at Google, expect 2 DSA rounds followed by 2 technical interviews before you even get close to an offer.

If you interview at Amazon, you’ll face multiple DSA and technical rounds each one designed to test your problem-solving depth.

Most top companies, follow a similar interview structure:
— DSA round(s) to screen your fundamentals
— More technical interviews (sometimes system design, sometimes advanced DSA)
— Only after clearing these do you reach project or culture fit rounds

If your DSA isn’t up to the mark, you won’t even make it to round 2.
I’ve seen so many talented people get blocked simply because they lose the DSA round.

The #1 mistake?
→ They don’t study DSA pattern-wise.
Most students don’t fail DSA interviews because they’re bad at coding.
They fail because they don’t recognize the underlying pattern, so every new problem feels brand new, and pressure makes them fail. 

And that’s why you should check this great DSA pattern sheet I’ve personally used and recommended to many people.
✅ Learn which pattern to use for which problem
✅ Map interview keywords to real solutions
✅ Practice 5–6 Leetcode must-solves per pattern
✅ Track your progress and build a real interview toolkit

Grab your copy here: https://bit.ly/3ZfjZzl

Prep smart, spot patterns, and walk into your next interview ready to solve.
Let’s get you that offer!!

When I was invited to speak at the GCS Conclave 2025, I stepped onto that stage with a mission to challenge how we teach sustainability in our schools today.

This premier forum brought together leaders from academia and industry to discuss 'Convergence for Change: Education and Industry Driving Sustainable Development.'

The panel discussion on 'Embedding Sustainable Approaches for Social Equity' opened my eyes to new perspectives. 

I'm filled with gratitude to share the stage with such remarkable individuals:
📍Lt General A Arun (Moderator, Advisory, SEI)
📍Tarun Mehta (Co-founder & CEO, Ather Energy)
📍Dr. Franco Curmi (Head of Marketing, University of Malta)
📍Rev. Fr. Jesudoss Rajamanickam (Director, St. John's Academy)
📍Dr. K Gayathri Reddy (Executive Director, MGIRED)
📍Kamal Sagar (Founder & Chairman, Total Environment Building Systems Pvt Ltd)
📍Dr. Julien Paret (Director, Alliance Centre for Eurasian Studies)

Here’s what the experience reminded me:

1️⃣Sustainability can't be taught through diagrams alone.
 It needs to be lived, felt, questioned, and sometimes even argued with.

2️⃣Education must go beyond intellectual awareness to emotional understanding.
My 3rd standard students couldn't explain hunger. How will they understand the sustainable development goals if they don't comprehend the basic problems these goals aim to solve?

3️⃣Platforms like GCS Conclave are essential.
Because they challenge institutions to do better.

4️⃣Equality sounds fair in theory. But equity is what meets people where they are.
Especially in sustainability, where rural kids turn off lights not to save energy, but because it might not come back.

Thank you to Surana College and the GCS team for curating such a meaningful dialogue, and to the audience for receiving my words with openness and curiosity.

As someone working in the education space, this isn’t just a panel talk for me, but it’s a call to action.

So I’ll leave you with this:
What are we truly teaching our children about sustainability, and what’s still missing?

As a student passionate about tech and innovation, I just built a smart AI-powered virtual assistant using n8n and OpenAI GPT-4o-mini!
🧠 This AI Agent acts just like a personal assistant — it can:
📅 Schedule events in Google Calendar
⛅ Fetch live weather updates
📊 Read and process data from Google Sheets
📬 Send alerts via email and messaging
💭 Remember context using Simple Memory
⚙️ How It Works:
🗣️ The user sends a message like:
 “Schedule a meeting tomorrow at 3 PM” or
 “What’s the weather in Bangalore?”
🧠 The AI Agent (powered by GPT-4o-mini) understands the request, uses memory to retain details (like location or names), and…
🔀 Automatically chooses the right tool:
If it's a weather query → calls get_weather API
For scheduling → triggers create_event
For data lookup → connects to Google Sheets
📤 The result is sent back via email or messaging — like a real-time, responsive assistant.
💡 Why It’s Special:
🔁 Context-aware (remembers what you said earlier)
🧠 AI-driven logic for smart decision making
🔌 Modular design — easily extendable
💬 Interacts in natural language, just like chatting with a human
This project helped me explore:
 ✅ Workflow automation
 ✅ API integration
 ✅ Prompt engineering
 ✅ Context-based AI interactions
Grateful for this hands-on learning experience and excited to keep building smarter, more helpful tools!

25 LLM Prompting Principles

Have you ever wondered how to transform your interactions with LLMs? 

🌟 Use Role-Based Prompting
'You are a cybersecurity expert. Explain how firewalls work.'

🌟 Specify Format
'Summarize this article in bullet points.'

🌟 Set Constraints
'Explain machine learning in 50 words or less.'

🌟 Provide Examples
'Generate a cold email. Example: 'Hey [Name], I noticed…'’

🌟 Chain of Thought
'Solve this math problem step by step.'

🌟 Ask for Multiple Variations
'Give me three different subject lines for this email.'

🌟 Direct Focus
'Summarize only the key takeaways from this article.'

🌟 Use Negative Prompts
'Write a sales pitch without using buzzwords.'

And the list goes on! 
Each strategy empowers your LLM to deliver tailored and relevant results, enhancing productivity and transforming your workflow.

🌟 Why It Matters?
In a world driven by data and digital interactions, mastering prompt strategies is essential. They enable clearer communication and foster innovative problem-solving.

🌟 Follow the AIKaDoctor (Free AI & Data Science Resources) channel on WhatsApp: https://lnkd.in/dCTCEKKc
